intro: Mesembryanthemum graniticum, commonly known as the granite daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of yellow and orange, are typically short-lived but attract various pollinators. Mesembryanthemum graniticum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
